column4: I tried to install from the old (5.10) CD this afternoon, and I had a harddisk that the BIOS had incorrectly recognized (it's a 200G disk, I think the BIOS puked over that) so Ubuntu installs on it just fine it seems, but HORRENDOUSLY slow.
I actually decided to put an old 6G drive in there and *boom* it goes really fast again.
I would be surprised if upgrading from 5.10 saved you any time at all over simply redownloading a new image.
